intro: Hieracium villosiceps subsp. sericotrichum, commonly known as the woolly hawkweed, is a perennial herbaceous plant belonging to the family Asteraceae. It is characterized by its hairy, erect stems and basal rosettes of leaves, which are typically covered in fine, white pubescence. The plant produces yellow flowers arranged in composite flower heads, which are typical of the daisy family. It thrives in disturbed soils and open habitats, often found in meadows and along roadsides. Due to its ornamental value and adaptability, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens.
